Tour of the French Riviera from Monaco to Cannes, 21 April 2003

---Playing petanque. Balls are the size of an orange, hollow, and always made from metal. This is not the Italian game of bocce, although some confuse the two.---
---Saint-Paul was a rendez-vous of the poets Jacques Prevert and Jean Cocteau, the artists Braque, Bonnard, Derain, Duty, Matisee, and Picasso.---
---Today artisans and craftsman ply their paintings and wares here---

---Pigeons love the tile roofs---
---Looking from the ramparts down into a private home---
---More homes near Saint-Paul---

---And other villas up the hillsides. Good thing there is no snow in this area.---
---Lawns are truly beautiful as trees and shrubs flower in the early spring---
---Flowers are everywhere---
